newsitem.title: USA: Honeywell files $500 mln debt shelf.
newsitem.headline: Honeywell files $500 mln debt shelf.

text.p: Honeywell Inc filed Tuesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission a shelf registration to sell up to $500 million in debt securities.

Net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes, including working capital, repayment or repurchase of outstanding indebtedness and other securities of the company, possible acquisitions and capital expenditures, Honeywell said in the filing.

Honeywell, based in Minneapolis, is an international controls corporation that supplies automation and control systems, components, software, products and services for homes and buildings, industry and space and aviation.
The offering is being made by Honeywell Finance NV, based in Amsterdam, and Honeywell Canada Ltd, based in Ontario.
